title: Ojima-ojo
author: Ojima-ojo
created_time: August 02, 2022, 09:26:17 AMLast edit: August 13, 2022, 05:44:27 PM by Ojima-ojo
content: This is a typical reflection of how bullish and creative Bitcoin/satoshi fans could be against wall street.http://Screen shot source: https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/wdd101/satoshi_nakamoto_riding_the_wall_street_bull_by/?utm_medium=android_app&utm_source=share

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on August 02, 2022, 09:26:17 AMThis is a typical reflection of how bullish and creative Bitcoin/satoshi fans could be against wall street.Screen shot source: https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/wdd101/satoshi_nakamoto_riding_the_wall_street_bull_by/?utm_medium=android_app&utm_source=shareThere's indeed much anticipations for the bullrun to begins, though there's certainty about this to happen very sooner or later.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: RILWAN on August 02, 2022, 04:55:39 PMThe whole crypto community is waiting for the next bull run, as this has been most anticipated and the 2023 bull run will be a massive one even more than what we saw in 2022.Actually when you look at very well it's quite understood that cryptocurrency generally to have a good change in the market it's been determined by the good will of Bitcoin. Everybody is waiting for bullish market for cryptocurrency to have attraction of investment from people who are new into the system.i believe that Bitcoin will have a good development in the next two years coming

comments.author: Piesel
comments.body: Quote from: GeorgeJohn on August 02, 2022, 05:03:54 PMQuote from: RILWAN on August 02, 2022, 04:55:39 PMThe whole crypto community is waiting for the next bull run, as this has been most anticipated and the 2023 bull run will be a massive one even more than what we saw in 2022.Actually when you look at very well it's quite understood that cryptocurrency generally to have a good change in the market it's been determined by the good will of Bitcoin. Everybody is waiting for bullish market for cryptocurrency to have attraction of investment from people who are new to the system.  i believe that Bitcoin will have a good development in the next two years comingBitcoin is already having good traction in the market, if you look back at what the price of Bitcoin was in the last couple of years back let's say around 2014 the price was low and even awareness was at a basic level but today Bitcoin is beginning to gain the mainstream attention and also making several all-time highs.So if the meme is correct we will all be waiting for another bull season and I must agree with both of you on your point on this subject matter, the entire crypto space is waiting for the next bull season.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: Lol, this image was made by the neural network, doesn't take any creativity to type text into a box and get an image from the program.And what's this about Bitcoin vs Wall Street? What does Bitcoin have to do with stock market? Bitcoin is alternative to fiat and fiat payment networks, not to stock market or the whole financial system.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: Now I'll be waiting for someone to start making metal statues like that and selling them online. Maybe one day they sabotage the real bull at night and put a figure of Satoshi on it.Quote from: hatshepsut93 on August 02, 2022, 09:50:22 PMLol, this image was made by the neural network, doesn't take any creativity to type text into a box and get an image from the program.And what's this about Bitcoin vs Wall Street? What does Bitcoin have to do with stock market? Bitcoin is alternative to fiat and fiat payment networks, not to stock market or the whole financial system.If only Bitcoin could not follow the s&p 500 anymore  I'd really like that, but for now we're stuck in this situation where dollar goes up - bitcoin and stocks go down. Some wall street company decides it doesn't like bitcoin anymore and we go down. Te SEC, which shouldn't have anything to do with bitcoin, does something and bitcoin reacts.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on August 02, 2022, 09:26:17 AMThis is a typical reflection of how bullish and creative Bitcoin/satoshi fans could be against wall street.This picture doesn't mean what you think it means.This looks more like someone is trying to reflect the very new FUD that they have been telling people regarding the non-existent correlation between bitcoin and US markets. The big lie that says "bitcoin rises because US stock market rises and it falls if it falls".

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: this is meant to be about some AI not only scanned the internet for current trending themes to come to a merged conclusion of "bitcoin bull". but also then render that theme into a unique image(supposedly)i tried to do a lazy google search for stock images/google images of brass statues/figurines that match the topics image. and didnt find an easy resulti began to think.. did AI actually do a new 3d model of a new figurine of a hooded guy riding a bull.which would be an impressive layer of AI thinking to be that creativebut (sceptical hat on)its just the shoddiness of what appears to be a crap photoshop of a small brass figurine in a bad focus of a background image to make it seem lifesize. but with all the crappy childish photoshop poor mistakes of 'background removal' of the figurine image( look at the hooded guys arm and the bulls ass and see the bad clipping of that layer of image background).. if its a complete render from some AI. there would be no photo-shop kiddy mistakes of this level if the image was new and unique.so im thinking..(sceptical hat still on) its just some teenager that poorly photoshopped some pics together created by human.  pretending he is some source employee making a leaked data/release from some AI company. .. done just for clickbait/discussion to make the image go viral, that might coax people to believe some billion dollar computer made it. so the photoshop kiddie can then NFT it for a high price

comments.author: nullama
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on August 03, 2022, 04:43:05 AMthis is meant to be about some AI not only scanned the internet for current trending themes to come to a merged conclusion of "bitcoin bull". but also then render that theme into a unique image(supposedly)i tried to do a lazy google search for stock images/google images of brass statues/figurines that match the topics image. and didnt find an easy resulti began to think.. did AI actually do a new 3d model of a new figurine of a hooded guy riding a bull.which would be an impressive layer of AI thinking to be that creativebut (sceptical hat on)its just the shoddiness of what appears to be a crap photoshop of a small brass figurine in a bad focus of a background image to make it seem lifesize. but with all the crappy childish photoshop poor mistakes of 'background removal' of the figurine image( look at the hooded guys arm and the bulls ass and see the bad clipping of that layer of image background).. if its a complete render from some AI. there would be no photo-shop kiddy mistakes of this level if the image was new and unique.so im thinking..(sceptical hat still on) its just some teenager that poorly photoshopped some pics together created by human.  pretending he is some source employee making a leaked data/release from some AI company. .. done just for clickbait/discussion to make the image go viral, that might coax people to believe some billion dollar computer made it. so the photoshop kiddie can then NFT it for a high priceIt actually is the creation of an AI.In the last couple of years text-to-image generation trough deep learning has advanced tremendously. It is now at a stage in which it is able to create surprisingly real results.Some of the best systems at the moment are Google’s Imagen and OpenAI’s DALL-E 2.This is one of the examples created by Imagen, using only text as an input (teddy bear swimming butterfly):They are getting better and better every few months. It's crazy really...

comments.author: franky1
comments.created_time: August 03, 2022, 09:59:35 AMLast edit: August 03, 2022, 10:59:28 AM by franky1
comments.body: i understand AI and the ACTUAL DALL-E 2 image creatorbut looking at the ACTUAL DALL-E 2 portfolio, and then looking at the random reddit post where there is no other source proving its DALL-E ... my paragraph about how it came to the descriptor is what i would initially presume as another AI that exists, which searches around for trending topics and comes to a merged summarybut then a second thought later. actually looking at the picture. i thought. something looks off with the picture. you just then have to look at the bad photoshop to see it doesnt look like DALL-E stylelike it seems like a bad photoshop  (EG the bad snipping under the left arm(right side) and the bulls butt.)  rather then the quality renders DALL-E actually has shown to achieve

comments.author: nullama
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on August 03, 2022, 09:59:35 AMi understand AI and the ACTUAL DALL-E 2 image creatorbut looking at the ACTUAL DALL-E 2 portfolio, and then looking at the random reddit post where there is no other source proving its DALL-E ... my paragraph about how it came to the descriptor is what i would initially presume as another AI that exists, which searches around for trending topics and comes to a merged summarybut then a second thought later. actually looking at the picture. i thought. something looks off with the picture. you just then have to look at the bad photoshop to see it doesnt look like DALL-E stylelike it seems like a bad photoshop  (EG the bad snipping under the left arm(right side) and the bulls butt.)  rather then the quality renders DALL-E actually has shown to achieveYou can see that it was generated by DALL-E by looking at the bottom right of the image. It has its "signature", which is a band of colors. It was cropped a bit though by OP or someone else.AI generated images have many different artifacts, that's usually normal. Most of the images posted are the best ones, while the ones with artifacts are just ignored.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: hatshepsut93 on August 02, 2022, 09:50:22 PMLol, this image was made by the neural network, doesn't take any creativity to type text into a box and get an image from the program.And what's this about Bitcoin vs Wall Street? What does Bitcoin have to do with stock market? Bitcoin is alternative to fiat and fiat payment networks, not to stock market or the whole financial system.This lol. People like throwing the words "wall street" around not knowing that Bitcoin is (arguably) against the federal reserve(and/or the authorities in general).Not sure why they think Bitcoin should fight against startups and business equity lol; assuming they actually know what wall street is.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: Quote from: nullama on August 03, 2022, 11:16:56 PMYou can see that it was generated by DALL-E by looking at the bottom right of the image. It has its "signature", which is a band of colors. It was cropped a bit though by OP or someone else.point was, as a theme. the image met its title in a good way... but as for the quality of image. it looked like a bad photoshop. compare it to the teddy swimming. you cant really see the snipping or layering. it doesnt look like a photoshop kiddie. it looked like finalised art piece. anyway dall-e 2 is still learning
